fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence allows you to create users when the Delegated directory is at the top position. Although that's possible, the user will be treated as an external user while it does not exist in the LDAP.

This will cause problems with the authentication as the user exists in Confluence but not in the LDAP.

This specific behavior is related to [CONFSERVER-22296 - Provide an option to select user directory on adding/deleting users|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-22296], where you cannot choose the directory where the user will be saved.

h3. Environment
* Confluence
* Delegated directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Delegated Directory and move it at the top position.
# Create a new user in Confluence.
# The user will be shown as a Delegated User, however, the user does not exist in the LDAP.
# Try to login in Confluence with this user.

h3. Expected Results

* Confluence will create the user in the internal directory.
or
* Confluence will remove the ability to create users if the delegated option is at the top position


h3. Actual Results
* The interface will show that the user is coming from the LDAP, but the user does not exist in the LDAP.
* The authentication will fail.
* The database will show that the user is has a hashed password, but it should be "nopass".


h3.Workaround
There's no workaround for the bug, but to prevent this issue from occurring again, don't create users in Confluence if there's a delegated directory.
fields.summary: Delegated directory fails to authenticate users that are created in Confluence

fields.description:
A lot of us are using Confluence as a tool to document our own Atlassian tool installations.

When we type a file path such as {{/var/log/atlassian}} Confluence (and Jira) will automatically transform this to {{/var/log/Atlassian}}.
The same goes for 'jira' and 'JIRA' becoming Jira.
It prevents us from writing correct documentation.

Words like Confluence, Bamboo, Bitbucket, etc. do not suffer from this odd feature.

Please:
 * Allow admins to deactivate this feature
OR
 * Do not autocorrect those words when they are preceded by a non-whitespace character

 

Related issue: CONFSERVER-25133
This one was closed when Jira was changed to JIRA but the actual problem was never resolved thereofre I created this suggestion.
fields.summary: Add option to deactivate auto capitalization of 'Atlassian' and 'Jira'

h3. Issue Summary
Tested with Atlassian Companion Version 1.1.0 for Mac. If the page title is too long (noticeable when it's 60 characters long), the upload button will get pushed out of the window:
 !Screenshot 2020-06-04 at 3.34.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screenshot 2020-06-04 at 3.47.15 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add an office file in the page above
# Edit the attachment using Companion App

h3. Expected Results

fields.description:
This came in from a customer where we found a limitation of the Jira Issues macro.

The use case for "appending to a specific team" - this is not only to relating this to a specific team but more a means to group all these together.

Right now we have a table in Confluence that we create Jira issues from (could be user requirements etc) but there is no way to easily group these together as it may not need to be grouped by an epic but maybe a different items as these may only be part of the stories in an epic but want to still group these together.

In our example there is are numerous steps to rollout a process across a team so this is a template of work in Confluence which we then create per team. When creating these story's in Jira there is no way to note which team this is. So would be great if we could reference a field of information like Team name that can the show up on the created Jira issue, as opposed to a column on a table that needs to be populated for every row.

Instead of specifying an Epic to associate these tickets with or using a column, I'd like to be able to either specify a bulk item arbitrarily or have some more options when creating bulk issues.
fields.summary: Create bulk Jira issues from Confluence by specifying a common team field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user goes to print a Confluence page from their browser, they will randomly get a page with the text rendered in a smaller size. This appears usually when adding comments to a page and then going to print the page.

Specifically, this issue happens when using the browser's own print option and not Confluence's own export options. There are several valid reasons why a user will want to use this method instead of exporting from within Confluence, as currently there is not a method to include comments on a single page export (this option is only shown for whole Space exports) and Confluence will export the page different than what is shown unless the PDF export is customized with CSS/HTML.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page with a few paragraphs worth of content and save.
# Add a comment to the page and then immediately press CTRL + P to print the page from the browser.
# Notice that the text is smaller than what is shown on the page.
# Refresh the page and print it again. You will see that the text is back to its normal size.

h3. Expected Results

A page with the correct text size shown on the export.

!normal.png!

h3. Actual Results

The text is rendered in a smaller size.

!small.png!

h3. Workaround

Luckily refreshing the page seems to resolve this issue, however, this can be an extra step that can be tedious in workflows that need to export single pages with comments.
fields.summary: Text Size is Inconsistent When Printing Page

fields.description:
*Problem:*

To new or infrequent users, Confluence appears to "randomly" and silently fail to create pages. 

*Steps to Replicate:*
 # Navigate to a space
 # Click the "Create" button to create a new page
 # Name the page the same name as an existing page
 # Click "Publish"

*Expected Function:*

An helpful message or error should appear to explain the constraint.

*Root Cause:*

Page names must be unique in a Confluence space. 

*Additional Information:*

Browser: Google Chrome

Powered by [Atlassian Confluence|http://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence] 6.13.9
fields.summary: Show error message on page name collision

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If inline tasks are being worked on when editing a confluence page, and these published pages have tasks that are being checked or unchecked by others, the wrong task states will be published when the draft is published.

Example video:  [^tasks-checked-incorrectly.mov] 

This may be related to another issue observed in [CONFSERVER-59676|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-59676] where drafts do not show the Unpublished Changes warning message when tasks are modified.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a page with two or three task elements and publish the page without checking any tasks
2.  Edit the page again and create a new task between the existing ones (but don't publish and stay in edit mode)
3.  Open the same page in a second tab in view mode and check all the tasks
4.  In the first tab, you will now see that the wrong tasks are checked
5.  The then published page will have incorrect task states

h3. Expected Results

When task states are changed by others in published pages the state will be updated or notified in their drafts or edited pages.

h3. Actual Results

Changing task states in published pages will incorrectly overwrite the state of any new tasks that have been added or changed in edited pages.

h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround
fields.summary: Checking inline tasks will cause unpublished tasks to be set incorrectly

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Confluence Server and Data Center allowed remote attackers with system administration permissions to bypass velocity template injection mitigations via an injection vulnerability in custom user macros.

This issue was discovered and reported by GHSL team member [@pwntester (Alvaro Munoz)|https://github.com/github/securitylab_vulnerabilities/blob/master/vendor_reports/https/github.com/pwntester].

The affected versions are before version 7.4.5, and from version 7.5.0 before 7.5.1.

 

*Affected versions:*
 * version < 7.4.5
 * 7.5.0 ≤ version < 7.5.1

*Fixed versions:*
 * 7.4.5
 * 7.5.1
fields.summary: Velocity Template Injection in Custom user macros - Macros Platform - CVE-2020-4027

fields.description:
h1. Requirement

As the writer of a page I need to provide access to a particular confluence without giving them access to ancestor pages. This is so that they can access the specific page without accessing some sensitive ancestor pages. It is also so that I can put the page in question in the appropriate page in the hierarchy so it can be easily found by normal viewers/editors of that page tree.

h1. Example

Somewhere in a space there is this page subtree:

* Page A - restricted to users X and Y
** Page B - inherits restrictions from Page A
*** Page C - I want to permit user Z rights to view and edit just this page

h1. Additional notes

When adding a restriction to Page C it is not obvious that the rules on that page implement an AND. That is the user has to appear in both Page A's and Page C's restrictions in order for that person to have access. I thought that the rules were an OR, such that a user appearing in either restriction list would have access. This confused me.
fields.summary: Restrictions : A way to relax a restriction in a descendant page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a user uncheck the notify watcher option when editing a page, the option will get checked back if the user cookies is delete or expired in the browser or switched to another browser where new cookies is generated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
*Case 1*
# Access Confluence via Google Chrome
# Access a Confluence page
# Edit the page
# Uncheck the "Notify Watcher" option
# Save the page
# Clear the Chrome Browser cache and cookies
# Close Chrome
# Open Chrome and access to the same page
# Edit the page
# You will notice that the "Notify Watcher" option is checked
(i) This behavior affect all Chrome, FireFox, and IE 11 Browser

*Case 2*
# Access Confluence via Google Chrome
# Access a Confluence page
# Edit the page
# Uncheck the "Notify Watcher" option
# Save the page
# Access Confluence via FireFox or IE 11 browser
# Access the same page
# Edit the page
# You will notice that the "Notify Watcher" option is checked.
(i) For details, please review the following video
 [^Recording #12.mp4] 


h3. Expected Results
The Notify Watcher option will remain uncheck

h3. Actual Results
The Notify Watcher option is reset to check when cookies is deleted, expired, or recreated in other browser

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Notify watcher option is checked by default when user cookies is deleted or expired

fields.description:
h3. Problem
After a non-graceful Confluence shutdown, synchrony.pid isn't removed from confluence_install/temp/ folder. The next time Confluence starts, Synchrony is unable to start.

h3. Environment
Windows/Linux
Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Reboot the server or kill Confluence process in a non-graceful way
# Start Confluence

h3. Expected Results
Confluence and Synchrony process starts

h3. Actual Results
Only Confluence starts

h3. Workaround
# Shutdown Confluence
# Manually delete *confluence_install/temp/synchrony.pid*
# Start Confluence

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Synchrony is unable to start after a non-graceful Confluence shutdown

fields.description:
Hello, we are often using child pages for a "timeline" of meetings we already had about topic, and it would be great to have the newest ones at the top.

Space tools > Reorder pages tool seems to be just what I need, the only problem is that there is only a "sort alphabetically" button, so if I want to have reverse chronological or reverse alphabetical sort (child pages are named as "yyyy-mm-dd topic"), I need to reorder them manually.

Could you please consider adding buttons for "reverse alphabetical", "chronological" and "reverse chronological" sort?

Thank you! Tomas
fields.summary: Reorder pages tool - add "reverse alphabetical", "chronological" and "reverse chronological" buttons

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an _Excerpt-include_ macro displays content rendered from an _Office Excel_ macro, the content does not include an Edit button.
h3. Environment

Confluence 7.5.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page that includes an _Excerpt_ macro.
 ** Within this macro, insert an _Office Excel_ macro that references an Excel file that's attached to the page.
 # Next, create another page with an _Excerpt-include_ macro.
 ** Configure this macro instance to reference the _Excerpt_ macro created in the previous step.

h3. Expected Results

The Excel content rendered on the page that has the _Excerpt-include_ macro *should display* an *Edit* button located directly above the included Excel spreadsheet.
h3. Actual Results

The Excel content rendered on the page that has the _Excerpt-include_ macro *does not display* an *Edit* button located directly above the included Excel spreadsheet.
h3. Notes

The page that includes the _Excerpt_ macro does display the *Edit* button regardless of Confluence version.
h3. Workaround

The only known workaround for this issue would be to edit the Excel worksheet within the original source page that contains it.
fields.summary: Excerpt-include macro does not display an Edit button for Office Excel macro generated content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Hierarchy is lost when you create a child page before publishing the "draft-parent" page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Version 1* 
 * Visit page A
 * Press the 'Create' button
 * After the new page draft opens, press the 'Create' button _again_
 * Give the new page a name 'B' and 'Publish'

*Version 2* 
 * Visit a page 'A'
 * Press shortcut 'c' and _keep the key pressed_.
 * Wait until at least 2 page loads did occur
 * give the new draft a name 'B' and 'Publish'

h3. Expected Results
 * Confluence will not allow you to hit the "Create" button if you haven't published the page.
 * New page with hierarchy: A -> B

h3. Actual Results
 * On Page Information the parent is listed as "$webwork.htmlEncode($content.displayTitle)".
 * Checking internally in the database, the first page(Page A) will be a draft without title, hence causing the "$webwork.htmlEncode($content.displayTitle)".

*Notes*
 * After updating the null entries and rebuilding the ancestor table, the problem is still not resolved as it was created a page from a draft.
 * The page can be put back into the page hierarchy by simply doing a 'move' on it, and selecting a regular page as the new parent.

h3. Workaround
 
A workaround for this is to move the child page to a new parent page temporarily and then moving it back to it's original location
fields.summary: Pages are created outside of page hierarchy when triggering create page from draft

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary # Content imported from Confluence Cloud to Confluence Server display different. # Issue appears to be caused by Confluence Cloud and Server displaying the same storage format differently. ** {code:java}

{code} h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page in Confluence Cloud, and add some images and content with link breaks. # Export the Site or Space out, and import into Confluence Server. # Check on the content of the page in Confluence Server. h3. Expected Results * Content appears as it does in Confluence Server as it does in Confluence Cloud * !cloud.png|thumbnail! h3. Actual Results * Line breaks that appear in Confluence Cloud, separating the content, do not appear in Confluence Server. * !server1.png|thumbnail! h3. Workaround * There is no workaround other than to manually edit the pages and fix the formatting.

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement

According to [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-page-gadget-218275791.html] page, we ended support for the Confluence Page gadget in Confluence 7.0. 

This, however, does not apply to the Confluence Page Gadget on Jira, as it keeps working normally on Confluence 7.x versions. The documentation is not clear about that, and might give the impression that customers will need to use another gadget to reference Confluence pages on Jira, and this is not accurate.

h3. Suggest resolution

Please make the documentation more clear, as the Confluence page gadget is still available for Jira and is the only option to reference pages from Confluence.
fields.summary: Update our Confluence Page Gadget documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a page and formatting specific sections that have a <span> tag seems to cause unwanted effects when trying to switch a single heading, which causes the whole page to also get changed to the same formatting. This can be a major pain point if users copy over information that introduces these span tags into their connect.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page with several different headings already on there (H1, H3, Pre-formatted).
# Introduce a <span> tag to modify anything within the line.
# Simply put the cursor in middle on line on one of the headings
# Change the heading to another heading, such as H3 to Pre-formatted

h3. Expected Results

Only a single line should change.

h3. Actual Results

The whole page is changing to the same formatting.

h3. Workaround

Currently, the workaround is to remove the <span> tags.
fields.summary: Custom Span Tags Cause all Heading on Page to Change

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the page contains text that is bold and italic, a blank space will be added after the bold and italic text.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install source editor
# Create a Confluence page
# Add following sentence in the page.
{quote}
Testing source editor bold and italic.
{quote}
# Bold and italic the last word. (Do not bold and italic the . )
# Save the page
# Edit the page
# Click the <> button
# Click Apply and save the page
# A blank space is added between the last text and the dot.
(i) For details, please refer to the following video.
 [^Recording #11.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
No additional space is added after bold and italic text.

h3. Actual Results
additional blank space is added after bold and italic text.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Source Editor add blank space after bold and italic.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Related Labels macro will also bring labels that are no longer active.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two pages.
# On one page add two labels
#* label1 and label2
# On the second page, add only the "label2" and use the Related Label macro.
# Delete the first page that had the two macros.

h3. Expected Results
The Related Macro will not show any data

h3. Actual Results
The macro will show "label1" and "label2"
 
h3. Notes
Apparently, this behavior is being inherited from CONFSERVER-6520 and  CONFSERVER-43549

h3.Workaround
Purge the trash to completely delete the page along with the label.
fields.summary: Related Labels macro fetching content from deleted page

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When subscribing with or adding an account from a Team Calendar in macOS Catalina. the macOS calendar app does not contain checkboxes to select these individual calendars. All Caldav calendars from confluence are also displayed with blank colours. Any colour changes made last only a few moments and then revert to blank or unset, the latest on the next start of the application. There is also a similar problem in iOS 13.4 with a slightly different behaviour and all colours change randomly on reload.
h3. Environment

MacOS Catalina
 iOS 13.4
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a Team Calendar in Confluence with multiple calendars
 * Choose to subscribe to this calendar and either choose your app as Apple Calendar (MacOS) or Apple Calendar (iOS)
 * Add a new account or subscribe to the Caldav calendar in MacOS/iOS calendar.
 * Open the calendar app

h3. Expected Results

Team Calendars should behave in the same manner as other Caldav calendars in the app
h3. Actual Results

Team Calendar Caldav calendars do not contain checkboxes to select the individual calendars when uncoloured and they are also displayed with blank checkboxes, any attempt to colour them is reset again after a few seconds or when opening the app.
h3. Workaround

No workaround is currently available
h3. Notes

This does not occur in MacOS Mojave
 Other Caldav calendar hosts do work correctly, Nextcloud and Owncloud Caldav calendars behave as expected.
fields.summary: Team Calendar CalDav integration with iOS and macOS Catalina is not functioning correctly and does not reflect selected calendar colour

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page properties plugin sets thread local user without restoring it, it causes problem of leaking thread local context.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # It was reported by vendor that AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal.get() returns wrong user.
 # After analyzing the log, found the invocation of
{code:java}
com.atlassian.seraph.auth.AuthenticationContextImpl.setUser(AuthenticationContextImpl.java:23)
com.atlassian.confluence.user.AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal.set(AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal.java:21)
com.atlassian.confluence.extra.masterdetail.DetailsSummaryBuilder.renderDetailRowsWithTransaction(DetailsSummaryBuilder.java:295)
com.atlassian.confluence.extra.masterdetail.DetailsSummaryBuilder.lambda$renderDetailRows$4(DetailsSummaryBuilder.java:265)
{code}

 # Inspecting the code, the code does not restore thread local user after setting it.

h3. Expected Results

reset() was invocated after AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal.set() is called.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
om.atlassian.seraph.auth.AuthenticationContextImpl.setUser(AuthenticationContextImpl.java:23) com.atlassian.confluence.user.AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal.set(AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal.java:21) com.atlassian.confluence.extra.masterdetail.DetailsSummaryBuilder.renderDetailRowsWithTransaction(DetailsSummaryBuilder.java:295) com.atlassian.confluence.extra.masterdetail.DetailsSummaryBuilder.lambda$renderDetailRows$4(DetailsSummaryBuilder.java:265)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state
fields.summary: Page properties set thread local user without restoring it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While creating multiple Jira issues within Confluence editor from a table, the auto populated description does not retain any spacing.  When viewing the description in the Jira issue, all spacing and much of the formatting has been removed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce 

• Create a simple table with at least three rows.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 • Use the first row as the table headers.  The first one being Summary and second one Description.
 • Add "Test" as the summary in both empty cells in the "Summary" column.
 • Write two or more paragraphs with a space between or add a simple bulleted list to the empty cells in the column named Description.
 • Highlight the entire table and click the "Create Jira Issue" icon in the pop up
 • Click "Create Multiple Issues From Table"

 !screenshot-5.png|thumbnail! 

 • Select the correct headers for Summary and Description.
 • Create the Jira Issues.
 • Open the Jira Issues in Jira.
h3. Expected Results

The basic spacing and formatting is retained in the description in the Jira issue.
h3. Actual Results

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!  !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 

The Jira issue does not retain any spacing or most formatting in the Description.  This results in Descriptions which are formatted with spacing, bullets, or bold/italic/underlines being jumbled up and at times unreadable.   

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Issue description contains no formatting when created using Create Multiple Issues From Table in the Confluence Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attchment is not able to render when Confluence service Log On account is set to NetworkService.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence in Windows server as a service

java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError

Caused by: class com.aspose.slides.exceptions.ArgumentException: Illegal characters in path.
com.aspose.slides.internal.e5.catch.if(Unknown Source)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

A recent Tomcat vulnerability ([CVE-2020-9484|https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-9484]) in which an attacker can access the content and names of files on a server when custom PersistenceManager filestores are used was announced that affects the following versions:
 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M4, 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.34, 8.5.0 to 8.5.54 and 7.0.0 to 7.0.103

Confluence, as shipped, does not use PersistenceManager and is not vulnerable, but can be made so with customizations.

Affected versions of Tomcat include:
* 7.0.0 to 7.0.103
* 8.5.0 to 8.5.54
* 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.34
* 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.0-M4 

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an unaffected version of Tomcat (9.0.35 and above for Tomcat) in Confluence,
fields.summary: Upgrade Tomcat to the fixed version of CVE-2020-9484

fields.description:
As a Confluence administrator, it would be helpful to have improved logging round Synchrony:

* In a scenario where Confluence Data Center is managing Synchrony, and the internal proxy is not enabled, Sychrony traffic will be directed through /synchrony first, and failing that, will try /synchrony-proxy and finally confluence-context-path/synchrony-proxy. It wold be useful to know when/why Confluence uses the alternate paths to reach Synchrony. 
* Similarly, logging around failed websocket upgrades could help administrators understand why the failover to XHR occurs.
* There's a lot of noise in the Synchrony logs, and so the ability to filter out the noise would be useful. Unfortunately, changing the level of Synchrony logging from DEBUG to WARN (for example) stops all logging, so it can't be done that way.
fields.summary: Additional Synchrony logging

fields.description:
h3. Summary
+As a+ System Admin or Auditor
+I want to+ have a history of when users logged in, and when their user names had login attempts failed
+So that I can+ track successful and failed login attempts per user and Confluence instance

h3. Problem Definition

Customer is looking for ways to list a history of all the times users login successfully, and also when the login for that user fails (due to wrong password or account disabled, for instance).
Currently Audit Log and Access Logs do not provide that level of details.

h3. Suggested Solution

Audit log could be improved to contain that information.
 
h3. Workaround 
Options for that could be (although both unsupported):
* 3rd party SAML software could provide this kind of information
* Customizing the login screen to record that information
fields.summary: Additional log for successful and failed login attempts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the restoretrashitem.action to restore a page, Confluence prompts a not permitted notification to user when an external LDAP is in play.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Installed Confluence v6.15
 # Connected to Apache DS (any LDAP server will do)
 # Created a (same) username with space in it and synced it to Confluence
 !pk-2.png|width=163,height=110!
 # This user's personal space has a white space,
#* {code:sql}
select spacename, lowerspacekey, spacetype from spaces where spacename like '%Pat%';
{code}
#* {code:java}
spacename   lowerspacekey spacetype 
----------- ------------- --------- 
Pat Doe ~Pat Doe  personal  
{code}
# Created a page in personal space
# Deleted it
# Upon restore, got the same error!
 !pk-2.png|width=132,height=89!
# The issue didn't happen with other spaces
# Also, I renamed the user to without space,
# The issue still happened - because Space key is still the same. This also narrows down the cause to white space in Space Key

 
h3. Expected Results
Page restored from trash. 
h3. Actual Results
Confluence prompts notification: 
*Not permitted* 

h3. Workaround
We can use the REST API to restore the page. 
# Get the contentid for the deleted page. 
#* We can get this from URL when attempting to restore the deleted page from trash
#* {code:java}
http://localhost:8090/pages/restoretrashitem.action?key=~admin&contentId=917510
{code}
# We need to find the version number for the body. 
#* We can run this query against the database:
#* {code:java}
select * from content
where contentid=917510;
{code}
#* (i) We need to use the version column. 
# Run this REST API:
#* {code:java}
PUT http://localhost:8090/rest/api/content/917510

BODY
{  "version":
		{"number":2
		},
	"status": "current"
}
{code}
fields.summary: Restoring page from trash in personal space shows not permitted error for users with a space in their username

h3. Issue Summary
Content by Label Macro - simple display excerpt option  returns  all excerpt rows instead of only one row

According to official docs  [Content by Label Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-by-label-macro-145566.html] Display excerpts -> simple option 
displays the first line of text contained in an Excerpt macro any of the returned pages. If there is not an Excerpt macro on the page, nothing will be shown. However SImple display excerpts displays all the rows from excerpt macros 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create page A. 
 # Add Excerpt macro to the page. 
 # Add multiple lines of text into macro body
 # Add label "test" to the page
 # Create page B.  
 # Add "Content by label" macro to page B. Select label added to page A
 # Expand options menu 
 # Navigate to Excerpt Display option and select "simple"  parameter from the picklist. 
 #  Click on preview (or save macro and update the page)

h3. Expected Results
First line of the excerpt macro from page A is displayed

h3. Actual Results
All lines added to excerpt macro on page A are displayed 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:

{code:java}

{code}
This error is caused by a missing browserslist configuration file in the distribution package.


 To work around the issue, create the {{.browserslistrc}} file in source code root folder manually with the following content:
{code:java}
ie >= 11
last 2 Edge version
last 2 Chrome version
last 2 Firefox version
last 2 Safari version
last 2 and_chr version
last 2 and_ff version
last 2 ios_saf version
last 2 android version
{code}

fields.description:
Feature request for the Confluence app to be able to scan and auto-navigate to a Confluence page's URL displayed as a QR code.

h4. Use case:
Business is using Confluence as a knowledge base. The KB articles are Confluence pages each with a distinct QR code, and the codes are pasted around the premises. Current flow:

- Users scan the QR code with a separate app
- App processes the link, and a username/password prompt is thrown
- Users are then presented with a choice to open the link in the Confluence app or via a browser
- Users choose open-in-app and proceed to access the info

h4. Expected use case:

- Users open the Confluence app
- Confluence app is capable of scanning the QR code
- Confluence app navigates to the page in question as soon as the app sees the QR code
fields.summary: Ability to scan QR codes from within Confluence for navigation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence administrator I am able to import a specific space through the admin UI as explained in [Restoring a Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/restoring-a-space-152036.html].

Importing multiple spaces can take a long time thought the UI, since you need to perform the same task multiple times.
It would be interesting to have an API method to automate this task.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a REST API method to import a Confluence Space.
 
h3. Workaround 
Although the [SOAP-XML API|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/confluence-json-rpc-apis/] is deprecated, it is still available in Confluence while not all methods are ported to REST.

The Confluence administrator may use the [{{importSpace}} method|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/confluence/remote-confluence-methods/#management] to import a Confluence Space.

Below is an example of such an operation using Python:
{code}
#!/usr/bin/python

from __future__ import with_statement
import sys, string, suds, re, os, base64

from suds.client import Client
url = 'http://localhost:6733/c733/rpc/soap-axis/confluenceservice-v2?wsdl'
client = Client(url)

with open('Confluence-space-export-110203-4.xml.zip', 'rb') as myfile:
        data = myfile.read()
        encodedFile = base64.b64encode(data)

token = client.service.login('admin', 'admin');

outputpath = client.service.importSpace(token, encodedFile);

print outputpath;
{code}
fields.summary: As a Confluence Administrator I would like to import Spaces via REST API
Macro to list topics - Questions for Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding an image to a page and applying an image effect, if you choose drop-shadow the {{ImageFilterEffect}} thread will become long-running and cause a JVM pause while it's attempting to go to safepoint for garbage collection or other VM tasks. 

Pauses can be an upwards of 35 seconds, which is long enough to cause a node ejection in Data Center environments if the Hazelcast heartbeat is set to the default interval of 30 seconds or less. Other pauses can still be 9-24 seconds, during which the Confluence application would be totally inaccessible.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page and upload the *1MB-small-image.png* file (see below), which is under 1MB in size
 # Hover your mouse over the inserted image and select "Properties"
 # Choose the "Drop Shadow" effect and click OK
 # You will then observe a long pause while it processes this small image, during which time the JVM itself is paused

A similar long pause can be induced by using very large files also, (must be less than 16MB in size, which is the {{ImageFilterEffect}} plugin's default threshold). See *14MB-large-image.png* as an example. 

Only certain small files can induce the long pauses, as many less than 1MB images process in under 3 seconds. This is likely has more to do with the pixel count than it does with the size of the image, as the *3MB-small-image-fast-processing.png* example file (see below) will process faster than the 1MB example file - the difference being the pixel count. 
h3. Expected Results

The image will be displayed on the page with the image effect applied to it, and the whole process will complete in 2-3 seconds max.
h3. Actual Results

The JVM will pause for upwards of 9-35 seconds while processing the image effect due to the rush to safepoint being delayed by the {{ImageFilterEffect}} thread - it is suspected that {{ImageFilterEffect}} thread is executing native code while processing images, in which case the thread would ignore the call to safepoint until it's completed processing.

The following safepoint statistics output will be shown in the {{catalina.out}} file:
{code:java}
# SafepointSynchronize::begin: Timeout detected:
# SafepointSynchronize::begin: Timed out while spinning to reach a safepoint.
# SafepointSynchronize::begin: Threads which did not reach the safepoint:
# "ImageFilterEffect:thread-4" #284 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007ffa080d4000 nid=0x1059 runnable [0x0000000000000000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE

# SafepointSynchronize::begin: (End of list)
         vmop                    [threads: total initially_running wait_to_block]    [time: spin block sync cleanup vmop] page_trap_count
1119.475: CGC_Operation                    [     173          1              1    ]      [ 14748     0 14749     0    65    ]  1
         vmop                    [threads: total initially_running wait_to_block]    [time: spin block sync cleanup vmop] page_trap_count
1134.291: CGC_Operation                    [     173          1              3    ]      [  5667     0  5667     0     3    ]  1
{code}
The following system properties must be added to see the output above:
{code:java}
-XX:+UnlockCommercialFeatures 
-XX:+PrintSafepointStatistics 
-XX:PrintSafepointStatisticsCount=1 
-XX:+SafepointTimeout 
-XX:SafepointTimeoutDelay=20000 
{code}
The {{atlassian-confluence.log}} file will show the following:
{code:java}
2020-05-15 10:27:33,688 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-10] [confluence.image.effects.ImageFilterServlet] doGetInTransaction Doing a transform
2020-05-15 10:27:33,691 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-10] [confluence.image.effects.DefaultImageEffectsClientSupplier] buildServiceUri Attempting to parse: null
2020-05-15 10:27:33,712 DEBUG [ImageFilterEffect:thread-1] [confluence.image.effects.ImageFilterTask] processInMemory Processing transformation in memory
2020-05-15 10:27:43,711 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-10] [confluence.image.effects.ImageFilterServlet] transformAndRespond Timed out while doing the transform
 -- referer: http://10.125.91.51:8090/display/DRAG/Image+page+3 | url: /download/attachments/1540097/Bangkok_Thailand_2009-14MB.png | traceId: d99c9c2c222bca9b | userName: admin
java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:205)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.image.effects.ImageFilterServlet.transformAndRespond(ImageFilterServlet.java:331)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.image.effects.ImageFilterServlet.writeTransformToResponse(ImageFilterServlet.java:203)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.image.effects.ImageFilterServlet.doGetInTransaction(ImageFilterServlet.java:162)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.image.effects.ImageFilterServlet.lambda$doGet$0(ImageFilterServlet.java:139)
..truncated....
2020-05-15 10:27:43,715 DEBUG [http-nio-8090-exec-10] [confluence.image.effects.ImageFilterServlet] writeTransformToResponse Sending back the original
{code}
The following logging package must be set to DEBUG to see the output above:
{code:java}
com.atlassian.confluence.image	
{code}
h3. Workarounds
 # Disable the {{ImageEffectsPlugin}} system app in General Configuration -> Manage Apps -> System apps
 # Do not use the "Drop-Shadow" effect

[Limit the impact of Image Effects on Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/limit-the-impact-of-image-effects-on-confluence-952071975.html] describes a process to place an upper limit of 1MB on the images it will process and 4000x4000 pixels, however the *1MB-small-image.png* file (see below) is an example of a file slightly under 1MB and slightly under 4000x4000 pixels which still has this same problem, so limiting the images by file size or pixel size may not fully circumvent this issue unless you set the limiting threshold very low. 
h3. Sample Images
||14MB file||1MB file||3MB file ||
| * high pixel count
 * large size
 * is slow processing
 !14MB-large-image.png|thumbnail!| * small size
 * high pixel count
 * is slow processing
 !1MB-small-image.png|thumbnail!| * low pixel count
 * size is larger than the 1MB slow-processing example
 * is fast processing
 !3MB-small-image-fast-processing.png|thumbnail!|
fields.summary: Processing drop-shadow image effect on certain images causes long JVM safepoint pauses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[Contributors Summary Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/contributors-summary-macro-183470224.html] fails to render after renaming a user, if the system still has old "~favourites" style labels present.
 When trying to load the macro on a page, you will get:
 Error rendering macro 'contributors-summary'
 No user could be found with the username _old_user_id_

And com.atlassian.confluence.labels.Label.<init> stack is logged in support logs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The system needs to have old favourites labels with "~username:favourite" name, and content labelled by them.
 # Create a page and add [Contributors Summary Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/contributors-summary-macro-183470224.html] macro to it.
 # Take one of the existing users and rename their account (irrelevant of directory type)
 # Try to load a page with Contributors Summary Macro in it

h3. Expected Results
 * Macro Renders and loads as expected

h3. Actual Results
 * Instead of a macro, the following error is displayed:
 Error rendering macro 'contributors-summary

Below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
ERROR [https-] [xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller] handleMacroExecutionException Error rendering macro: contributors-summary
 -- url: /display/spaceid/pagename | page: 123456789 | traceId: 47b198dc9d81c55d | userName: username | referer: https://based_url/some_content | action: viewpage
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No user could be found with the username old_username
	at com.atlassian.confluence.labels.Label.<init>(Label.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.labels.ParsedLabelName.toLabel(ParsedLabelName.java:73)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.contributors.util.tasks.LabelRankingTask.execute(LabelRankingTask.java:40)
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

h4. Workaround 1
 You can try creating and then disabling a user account with an old username, this would allow for the macro to render

h4. Workaround 2
 You can delete old favourites label from the content and delete the label itself
 (!) *If you are unsure how to deal with the database, contact your DBA. Make sure to have the database backed up completely before going further. These SQL commands were tested in some environments and they worked as intended, however, it might not work in specific cases and newer versions of confluence as new constraints as changes may be done to the confluence database structure. As such, a database backup is mandatory in case something goes wrong and you need to revert.*
 # Check if there are legacy favourites labels still present in the system
 You should see one of the labels containing a username for the non-existent user
{code:java}
SELECT * FROM LABEL
WHERE NAME LIKE '~%'
AND OWNER IS NULL;
{code}
 # Check if any content is still tagged with old favourites labels
{code:java}
SELECT
l.labelid, l.name AS label, l.owner,
cl.contentid, cl.lastmoddate,
c.contenttype, c.title
FROM LABEL l
JOIN CONTENT_LABEL cl 
ON l.LABELID = cl.LABELID
JOIN CONTENT c
ON cl.CONTENTID = c.CONTENTID
WHERE l.NAME LIKE '~%'
AND l.OWNER IS NULL;
{code}
If you see any output, it means there are pages still labelled as old user favourites, those pages would not appear under users favourites as those are linked to a label that maps to nobody and using old favourites system, on newer Confluence versions favourites label has no username in the name field and is simply called "favourite" and maps to the user by the owner key value.
 # Shutdown Confluence
 # Take complete Confluence DB and File system backups and test on staging system first
 # Run the following queries to delete old favourites labels from _label_content_ table:
{code:java}
DELETE FROM CONTENT_LABEL
WHERE labelid IN (
SELECT labelid 
FROM LABEL WHERE name LIKE '~%'
AND owner IS NULL);
{code}
 # Then this query to delete old labels themselves:
{code:java}
DELETE FROM LABEL WHERE name LIKE '~%'
AND owner IS NULL;
{code}
 # Proceed with [Rebuild the Content Indexes From Scratch on Confluence Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-rebuild-the-content-indexes-from-scratch-on-confluence-server-110035351.html]
 # Test if the macro is rendered correctly
fields.summary: Error rendering macro 'contributors-summary'

h3. Description
When user export a page with title "Test Page" to a word file, the word file will be created with file name "Test+Page.doc". If the user use this word document to import it to another Confluence, Confluence will take the file name "Test+Page" as the page title instead of "Test Page".

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a page with title "Test Page"
# Export the page to word
# A word file with file name "Test+page" is generated
# Go to another space
# Select Import word document and select the word file we exported from step 3.
# Confluence will take the file name "Test+page" as the page title.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Result
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected result
The page is imported with the original title

h3.Workaround
The workaround will be manually change the page title before it is imported.
fields.summary: Export page to word will rename the page title.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Format cannot be converted" error log which is generated due to CONFSERVER-38055 operation doesn't represent right user and URL. The old log is logged repeatedly even after the other user accessed the other URL.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install vanilla Confluence
 # Create user *admin* and *testuser1*
 # Log in to the Confluence with *admin* user
 # Upload any Powerpoint file to the page
 # Go to the property setting of the above attachment and change the MEDIA_TYPE to any wrong one. e.g. _application/json_
 # Try to preview the above file from the page. You will get an error for example like this.
{code:yaml}
2020-05-14 02:22:58,119 ERROR [conversion-thread-0-internal] [conversion.impl.runnable.ConversionRunnable] doWork Format cannot be converted
 -- referer: http://confluence.url/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=65608&draftShareId=b3d96768-6ca1-4b8e-ad62-c385a0521cc9& | url: /plugins/drag-and-drop/upload.action | traceId: e2d9a05d6820f303 | userName: admin | action: upload
{code}
 # Log into the Confluence with *testuser1*
 # Do the same step as Step 4-6 to the other page using other files

h3. Expected Results

The error log should point the new URL which contains the right contentId(draftId) with *testuser1*
{code:yaml}
2020-05-14 02:43:43,755 ERROR [conversion-thread-0-internal] [conversion.impl.runnable.ConversionRunnable] doWork Format cannot be converted
 -- referer: http://confluence.url/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=950273&draftShareId=91dc8f7a-0d31-4027-b1db-06a70f3090a6& | url: /plugins/drag-and-drop/upload.action | traceId: 4a3b699dd0c73708 | userName: testuser1 | action: upload
{code}
h3. Actual Results

Even though this is an operation by *testuser1*, userName is logged as *admin* and the whole logged content is same as the one in Step 6.
{code:yaml}
2020-05-14 02:30:29,155 ERROR [conversion-thread-0-internal] [conversion.impl.runnable.ConversionRunnable] doWork Format cannot be converted
 -- referer: http://confluence.url/pages/resumedraft.action?draftId=65608&draftShareId=b3d96768-6ca1-4b8e-ad62-c385a0521cc9& | url: /plugins/drag-and-drop/upload.action | traceId: e2d9a05d6820f303 | userName: admin | action: upload
{code}
Apparently the first log that encountered this "Format cannot be converted" is repeated when the error is replicated in the same instance.

h3. Workaround
Restarting the Confluence will reset the memory of the old "Format cannot be converted" log.
fields.summary: Conversion thread writes error logs with improper user and URL

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary If a page title includes a ]], an extra space is added to the entries within an XML backup that reference this title. Under the following circumstances, this can cause the ensuing import of this XML backup file to fail: # If the total length of the title is 255 characters. # Or, if certain plugins are used which create entries in the *OS_PROPERTYENTRY* table that include the title and hit the *string_val* field's 255 character limit. h3. Steps to Reproduce h5. Example 1: # Create a page with a title of 255 characters including a *]]*: {code:java} Here is my page title [in brackets [no really]] 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 1234567890 12345678 {code} # Create an XML backup. # If you locate the title value within the entities.xml, notice that it is now 256 characters long and includes an extra space after *]]*: {code:java} {code} h5. Example 2: # Install the ServiceRocket Page Approval plugin. # Create a page with a number of characters in the title that when included with the base URL wrapped in an tag, is around 225 characters. Also this title must include a *]]*. For example: {code:java} CHG000012345-[HARDWARE DIAGNOSIS[ RESTART SERVER]] - ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOP291234567890{code} # Add an attachment to the page. # For the page ID in question, check the _string_val_ field of the *OS_PROPERTYENTRY* table for an entry that looks like this. Notice that the entry includes the base URL wrapped in an and this entry is 255 chars long: {code:java} An attachment for page CHG000012345-[HARDWARE DIAGNOSIS[ RESTART SERVER]] - ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOP291234567890 has bee {code} # Create an XML backup. # If you locate this value in the entities.xml, you'll see that it's now 256 characters long (with an extra space after the *]]*) which is long enough to cause a subsequent import of this file to fail. h3. Expected Results The XML backup process should should not add an extra space when it encounters double *]]* characters. h3. Actual Results Certain entries in the backup XML file can exceed 255 characters. If you import this XML backup, it will fail with the following message in the application logs: {code:java} 2020-05-13 16:27:47,864 ERROR [Long running task: Importing data] [confluence.importexport.xmlimport.BackupImporter] importEntities Cannot import the entities: -- url: /conf/longrunningtaskxml.action | referer: http://localhost:9614/conf/admin/restore-local-file.action | traceId: 1884ee64fe2b4620 | userName: charlie | action: longrunningtaskxml com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: could not execute statement ... Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: value too long for type character varying(255) {code} h3. Workaround There are a couple of possible workarounds: # Edit the entities XML file to remove the extra space. To make this easier, you could search for strings that match the pattern ]]   (eg. ]]spacespace) and replace with ]]  (eg. ]]space). If the file is particularly large, you could try using the [sed command|https://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/how-to-use-sed-to-find-and-replace-text-in-files-in-linux-unix-shell/]. # Locate the pages that have a *]]* in the title and either: ## Remove one of the brackets. ## Or, insert a space between the two brackets. *** And if using the Page Approval macro, add another attachment to the page to refresh the entry in the *OS_PROPERTYENTRY* table. ## Then create a new XML backup.
fields.summary: If a page title includes a ]], an extra space is added to the entries within an XML backup that reference this title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attempting to show the last row/column from the Office Excel macro is not appearing as it should on consecutive changes, and it will remain as originally set.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach an Excel file on a page
# Insert the Excel file with an Office Excel macro and set columns to 3 and rows to 3.
# Edit the Office Excel macro and insert the last row is 5 and the column is also 5.
# Click "Save" 

h3. Expected Results
The Excel document should only show the number of tables applied from the last row/column (5/5).

h3. Actual Results
The changes are not applied as they should and the Excel file remains the same without any changes (3/3).
 [^ExcelTest.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
As may be seen in the video, the workaround was to edit the file with the Companion App through {{Edit Excel}} feature and {{Upload}} it then only the changes are made for the {{last row/column}} set from the Office Macro.

(i) The bug still persists after:
* Disabling modules from Confluence previews related to Companion App
* Uninstalling Companion App
* Enabling Edit in Office dark mode
* Clearing plugins cache and in _Incognito Mode_
* Entering safe mode
fields.summary: Editing Excel file through Office Excel macro to show last row/column does not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to reuse a variable from the template menu, a new variable is created instead.

Per [Create a Template > Template Variables|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-a-template-296093779.html#CreateaTemplate-Templatevariables]:
{quote}You can add the same variable more than once in the same template, which is useful if you need the same information in more than one place on the page.
{quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new template.
 # Instead of typing $, use the template menu to create a new variable:  !image-2020-05-13-16-16-28-947.png!
 # Now, try to select the same variable from that menu in order to add a 2nd copy to the page.

h3. Expected Results

The variable is reused on the page.
h3. Actual Results

An additional $ is appended to the variable, creating a brand-new variable.

!6.15.8.png|width=348,height=221!
h3. Workaround

From the documentation on Templates:
{quote}Hint: Type $ and the variable name, then press Enter to add a new variable or to select an existing variable from a list of suggestions. The suggestions dialog shows variables already defined in this template.
{quote}
Confirmed reusing a variable in this way works as expected.
fields.summary: Additional $ added to variable when reusing variables in templates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Inspect Permissions plugin does not know about unlicensed users from JSD (Jira Service Desk).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Requires a Confluence instance that is linked to a Jira Service Desk,
 * Notice that we do not properly handle permissions for any unlicensed users coming from the Jira Service Desk.

h3. Expected Results

We handle the unlicensed users from Jira Service Desk in some way.
h3. Actual Results

We don't handle them.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Inspect Permissions should handle case where unlicensed users come from a Jira Service Desk

fields.description:
We are currently using Server v7.2.1

I have only just realised that the automatic system Watch alert Notification emails are sent using the full "browser URL", and not the short permanent page URL.

Consequently if the page is renamed or moved after the email Notification is sent, the link is broken!!

:(

The system should send the short permanent Tiny URL as per the <<Page Information>>.

 

As a (redacted) example, the link that the system sends out in the emails is 

[https://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxnts?src=mail&src.mail.product=confluence-server&src.mail.timestamp=15893xxxxxx0061&src.mail.notification=com.atlassxxxxxxx.plugins.confluence-notifications-batch-plugin%3Abatching-notification&src.mail.recipient=5c6979a3xxxxxx1518c6578960005&src.mail.action=view|https://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxnts/?src=mail&src.mail.product=confluence-server&src.mail.timestamp=15893xxxxxx0061&src.mail.notification=com.atlassxxxxxxx.plugins.confluence-notifications-batch-plugin%3Abatching-notification&src.mail.recipient=5c6979a3xxxxxx1518c6578960005&src.mail.action=view]

 

the Page Information Tiny link is 

https://xxxxxxxxxxxxxxx.xxxx/x/Koqm
fields.summary: Email Notifications should send short URL

fields.description:
Currently, we have the below experimental API to delete a page version in Confluence which works as I have tested locally.
{code:java}
DELETE http://localhost:5050/brisbane/rest/experimental/content/6193180/version/2
{code}
where
 * [http://localhost:5050/brisbane] is my Confluence URL
 * *6193180* is the Page ID
 * *2* is the page version

As the above API is termed as experimental hence the request is to have an approved API for the same work to delete specific Page version of a Page in Confluence.

Example, If a page has 15 versions such as v1.0, v2.0 ...... v15.0 and I want to delete v2.0 using REST API.

Regards
Avik
fields.summary: REST API  for deleting Confluence page version

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When multiple users are adding tasks at the same time in Confluence and one of them publishes the page, he/she becomes the task owner and these tasks will show under their profile >> Tasks >> "Created by me"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two users
 # Edit a page in Confluence by both user1 and user2 at the same time
 # Start adding tasks by each user at the same time
 # Publish the page by user 1
 # Go to User1 profile >> Tasks >> Created by me

h3. Expected Results

Tasks that were added by user2 should show under user2 profile
h3. Actual Results

Tasks that were added by user2 show under user1's profile, created by me
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Tasks added by multiple users at the same time become owned by the publisher

fields.description:
There is an existing suggestion request to provide the [CONFSERVER-54284 - Ability to customize "All updates" on the Dashboard|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54284]. It would be better if the dashboard the customization can customize differently for each group in Confluence.

For example, the feature should provide restrictions to content updates to a group. When a user that belongs to *group A* logs into Confluence, the user should only be able to view updates from *group A*.
fields.summary: Customize "All updates" on the Dashboard by groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After upgrading Confluence to 7.3.3, Synchrony is not getting started and throwing below error in the logs,
{code:java}
2020-03-20 14:30:29,874 WARN [lifecycle:thread-16] [plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.SynchronyInteropBootstrap] onStart An exception occurred while waiting for Synchrony to start: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /home/confluence/.cache/JNA/temp/jna12881934674336678335.tmp: /home/confluence/.cache/JNA/temp/jna12881934674336678335.tmp: failed to map segment from shared object: Operation not permitted

2020-03-20 14:47:11,572 ERROR [Long running task: EnableTask] [confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask] run Long running task "EnableTask" failed to run.
 -- url: /confluence/rest/synchrony-interop/enable | referer: https://t-conflu-app0.bnppua.net.intra/confluence/admin/confluence-collaborative-editor-plugin/configure.action | traceId: 20f1129098170d20 | userName: admin2
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class oshi.jna.platform.linux.Libc
	at oshi.software.os.linux.LinuxOperatingSystem.getProcessId(LinuxOperatingSystem.java:344)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.getConfluenceProcessId(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:702)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.setupEnvironment(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:391)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.trySetup(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:709)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.lambda$startProcess$1(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:603)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor$ScheduledFutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
2020-03-20 14:49:09,179 ERROR [diagnostics-os-thread] [hardware.platform.linux.LinuxGlobalMemory] <init> Failed to get mem_unit from sysinfo. {}
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.sun.jna.platform.linux.LibC$Sysinfo
	at oshi.hardware.platform.linux.LinuxGlobalMemory.<init>(LinuxGlobalMemory.java:62)
	at oshi.hardware.platform.linux.LinuxHardwareAbstractionLayer.getMemory(LinuxHardwareAbstractionLayer.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.internal.diagnostics.OperatingSystemMonitor.getAvailableMemory(OperatingSystemMonitor.java:211)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.internal.diagnostics.OperatingSystemMonitor.checkFreeMemory(OperatingSystemMonitor.java:158)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.internal.diagnostics.OperatingSystemMonitor.lambda$startMonitorThread$1(OperatingSystemMonitor.java:122)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
2020-03-20 14:51:09,182 ERROR [diagnostics-os-thread] [hardware.platform.linux.LinuxGlobalMemory] <init> Failed to get mem_unit from sysinfo. {}
{code}
Optionally, you may see an error message like this:

 
{code:java}
2021-09-09 10:28:46,460 WARN [lifecycle:thread-4] [plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.SynchronyInteropBootstrap] onStart An exception occurred while waiting for Synchrony to start: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /home/confluence/.cache/JNA/temp/jna10310710589654609994.tmp: /home/confluence/.cache/JNA/temp/jna10310710589654609994.tmp: failed to map segment from shared object: Operation not permitted
{code}
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence for ex: 7.3.3 in the Linux OS where Confluence home is in /home and Confluence install is in /dev .
 # Mount /home to exec permission using the below command and check the permission after that.
{code:java}
$ mount --bind /home /home
$ mount -o remount,exec /home
{code}
!Screenshot 2020-04-04 at 11.24.27 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2020-04-04 at 11.26.12 PM.png|thumbnail!

 # With this Configuration, Synchrony gets started properly.
 !Screenshot 2020-04-04 at 11.34.49 PM.png|width=1428,height=261!
 # Now let’s Change /home to *noexec* using below command, Stop Confluence and execute below command,
{code:java}
mount -o remount,noexec /home
{code}
!Screenshot 2020-04-04 at 11.38.59 PM.png|thumbnail!

 # After this change, restart the Confluence

h3. Expected Results

Synchrony should start properly without checking mount point permission. Before Confluence 7.1.x , the issue is not reproducible. If the mount has noexec, Synchrony is getting started without any problem.
h3. Actual Results

Users are unable to start the Synchrony and getting below error with Confluence version 7.x.x.
{code:java}
2020-04-04 18:13:12,561 ERROR [StartEventPublisher:thread-1] [hardware.platform.linux.LinuxGlobalMemory] <init> Failed to get mem_unit from sysinfo. {}
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /home/hemant/.cache/JNA/temp/jna40762817292981485.tmp: /home/hemant/.cache/JNA/temp/jna40762817292981485.tmp: failed to map segment from shared object
	at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1946)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1828)
2020-04-04 18:14:59,078 ERROR [Long running task: EnableTask] [confluence.util.longrunning.ConfluenceAbstractLongRunningTask] run Long running task "EnableTask" failed to run.
 -- url: /rest/synchrony-interop/enable | referer: http://192.168.1.8:8090/admin/confluence-collaborative-editor-plugin/configure.action | traceId: 80bbe0e1a4d102dd | userName: admin
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class oshi.jna.platform.linux.Libc
	at oshi.software.os.linux.LinuxOperatingSystem.getProcessId(LinuxOperatingSystem.java:344)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.getConfluenceProcessId(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:702)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.setupEnvironment(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:391)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.trySetup(DefaultSynchronyProcessManager.java:709)
{code}
Similar issues can be caused if there is not enough space where the JNA temp dir exists:
{code:java}
WARN [lifecycle:thread-27] [plugins.synchrony.bootstrap.SynchronyInteropBootstrap] onStart An exception occurred while waiting for Synchrony to start: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Failed to create temporary file for /com/sun/jna/linux-x86-64/libjnidispatch.so library: No space left on device
{code}
{code:java}
Caused by: java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: Failed to create temporary file for /com/sun/jna/linux-x86-64/libjnidispatch.so library: No space left on device
{code}
h3. Environment
 * Confluence version 7.x onwards
 * Linux / Unix like Operating system

h3. Notes

This issue does not usually occur before Confluence 7.1.x versions.

The issue may happen even if Confluence is not installed under the home folder. This is because the *jnidispatch.path* is defined under the home folder of the user account that owns the Confluence process. This is where the JNA temp files are located, hence the error on the logs.
h3. Workaround

There are 3 workarounds to fix this issue:
 # Remount /home as exec permission. For this use below command,
{code:java}
$ mount -o remount,exec /home
{code}

 # Transfer Confluence Home directory to another File system which has exec permission.
 # Or, change the JNA temp dir with the following system property:
{code:java}
-Djna.tmpdir=<path>{code}

(i) In addition to remounting, be sure that the ID running the Confluence process has the proper permissions and ownership of the _logs_, _temp_, and _work_ subfolders under the installation folder per [How to set file system permissions for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-set-file-system-permissions-for-confluence-986879252.html] - otherwise the same error will appear after startup:
 * sudo chown -R confluenceID <confluence-install-folder>/logs
 * sudo chown -R confluenceID <confluence-install-folder>/work
 * sudo chown -R confluenceID <confluence-install-folder>/temp
 * sudo chmod -R u=rwx,g=rx,o=rx <confluence-install-folder>

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When users have had username clashes, the Inspect Permission feature interpret's "Unknown users'" permissions as anonymous permissions

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Confluence with an external user directory, and two users, usera and userb.
# In Confluence, grant userb individual permission to a space, or global "Can use" permission to the instance.  Do not grant anoymous access to the space or globally.
 # In the external directory, delete userb
# Sync confluence with the external directory
# Observe that the space/global permissions are still shown, but they are now shown as belonging to "Unknown user"
# Rename usera to userb
# Observe that the space/global permissions are still shown as belonging to "Unknown user"
# Restart Confluence
# Use the Inspect permissions screen to check the permissions in the space or globally.  Particularly check <anonymous> permissions

An alternative way to produce this bug is to have multiple external directories that provide different users with the same username.

h3. Expected Results
The original userb permission should have no effect on inspect permissions

h3. Actual Results
The original userb permission will show as granting anonymous access.  This will show both as the permission anonymous users have, and will also be shown as all groups having that access to the space via anonymous access.

h3. Workaround

You can use the following query to get a list of spaces and users that have these permissions:
{code:sql}
select s.spacekey, u.user_key, u.username, u.lower_username
from spaces s, spacepermissions sp left join user_mapping u on sp.permusername = u.user_key
where s.spaceid = sp.spaceid
  and u.user_key is not null and u.lower_username is null
{code}

Then visit the space permissions screen for any spaces listed, and, assuming the Unknown users are genuinely obsolete remove the space permissions of the Unknown users. Under most circumstances Unknown user permissions will be obsolete and have no further value. Possible exceptions are if the Confluence instance's user directories have been temporarily rearranged or altered and so the other users will be restored later.

And restart Confluence.  Or disable and enable the "Inspect Permissions - Gatekeeper" plugin.

This bug is fixed in 7.4.1 and 7.5.0
fields.summary: Inspect permissions shows incorrect anonymous permissions

h3. Problem

When trying to insert Jira Issue Macro in Confluence table using "+" insert more content from the menu option, it is getting inserted at different place/row than desire place.

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.15.4 & 6.15.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
 # Open a Confluence page for editing, insert a table, write a text in a table cell and cursor should be at the right position (Pic A).
 # Click on the (+) Insert more content menu option and then on "Jira Issue/Filter" (Pic B).
 # Select a Jira Issue and click "Insert" (Pic C).
 # The link is inserted at a random position (Pic D). 
  

h3. Expected Results
It should be inserted at the position where cursor was present.

JIM getting inserted at random position/row in the table.

When using shortcut "{" to insert JIM, it works as desire.

* Tested in 6.15.4 and 6.15.10 . 
* Screenshots and video attached

fields.description:
h3. Problem
While clicking on the space menu in the top left corner of the Confluence Web User Interface, the space header name can be overlapped with some other displayed items if the current web page is zoomed (more than 120% in my testing) and/or if the display screen is set to "scale in".

h3. Environment
Confluence Server v7.4.0 fresh install

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect to the Confluence User Interface via Chrome or Firefox
# Set:
#* Either the Zoom on the webpage to be 120+% via the Web Browser options
#* Or Use a Scale-In factor on your display as per the screenshots provided
# In both cases, if you try to switch spaces or clicking on the "Spaces" button in the top left corner of the UI, it can cause the Space Name displayed to overlap some other contents.

h3. Expected Results
The behavior should be consistent regardless of the Zoom or Scale-in factor defined on the displayed screen. No data should overlap in the Confluence UI.

h3. Actual Results
Data can overlap if Zoom >120% (from testings) defined in the Web Browser and/or Scale-in factor defined at the Screen/Display.

h3. Workaround
Go back to 100% Zoom and make sure not having any Scale-In factor defined for the display.

h3. Notes
# A video with steps to reproduce in a fresh v7.4.0 instance is attached 
# Screenshots on how to set your Screen for both MacBook Pro and Windows are attached. You can also just use the embedded zoom feature from Chrome as shown in the recording
fields.summary: Confluence Space Menu issue when accessed from a Zoomed in Webpage or Scaled-in Display

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The [Spaces List Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/spaces-list-macro-139375.html] creates a panel the page with a list of Spaces available in the Confluence instance.
The user adding this macro can choose from the following options on which Spaces will be listed:
{quote}
 * *(blank) -* All spaces in your site, with tabs.
 * *all* – All spaces in your Confluence site.
 * *category* – Spaces grouped according to space categories.
 * *favorite* – Spaces which you have added to My Spaces.
 * *new* – spaces created within the last 7 days.
{quote}

The options *all* and *category* (which is the default when the option is left on _blank_) will fetch *all* the Spaces from the Confluence instance and show that as an output within the page.

For Enterprise-sized instances, having thousands of Spaces is a common situation.
Depending on how the cache is, Hibernate will need to retrieve this heavy data from the database, since it won't paginate the request.
If the page containing the macro is requested by multiple users at the same time, then it may create an event on which the database server is overloaded, cascading the issue to any other operation that may require information from the database.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla instance of Confluence.
 # Create a Page in a sample Space and add a Spaces List Macro with the default options.
 # Create 4,000 Spaces.
  #* You may use the following script to create them.
{code}
ADMIN_USRNAME=admin
ADMIN_PWD=admin
CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8090/confluence
 
SPACE_KEY=SPC
SPACE_NAME=SPACE_
SPACE_DESC=TEST_SPACE
 
for i in $(seq 1 4000); do
 curl -u $ADMIN_USRNAME:$ADMIN_PWD -X POST -H 'content-type: application/json' ${CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL}/rest/api/space -d '{ "key": "'${SPACE_KEY}${i}'", "name": "'${SPACE_NAME}${i}'", "description": { "plain": { "value": "'${SPACE_DESC}'", "representation": "plain" } }, "metadata": {} }' >/dev/null 2>&1
done
{code}
 # Go to *Cog icon* > *General Configuration* > *Cache Management* and flush all caches.
  #* This will force Confluence to go the database on subsequent requests.
 # Run 10 simultaneous requests to display the page with the Spaces List Macro.
  #* You may use a script similar to the below to run the 10 requests.
{code}
USER_USRNAME=user
USER_PWD=user
CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL=http://127.0.0.1:8090/confluence
SPACE_KEY=SPACE123
PAGE_WITH_MACRO=Page+with+Spaces+List+Macro

for i in $(seq 1 10); do
nohup curl -u ${USER_USRNAME}:${USER_PWD} ${CONFLUENCE_BASE_URL}'/display/'${SPACE_KEY}'/'${PAGE_WITH_MACRO} >/dev/null &
done
{code}

h3. Expected Results
All requests are completed in a timely manner without overloading Confluence nor the database.
If the number of Spaces are too high, the resulting list will be paginated, similar to the presentation seen in the [Space Directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/the-space-directory-777010843.html].

h3. Actual Results
A single request takes a long time to complete and the simultaneous requests may overload the database if the information can't be retrieved from the cache.

The results below were taken from a test instance when requesting the target page once from the browser depending on how many Spaces are in the Confluence instance.
||Number of Spaces||Processing Time||HAR image||
|100|0.5s| !har-img-001.png|thumbnail! |
|500|1.13s| !har-img-002.png|thumbnail! |
|1,000|2.33s| !har-img-003.png|thumbnail! |
|2,000|4.71s| !har-img-004.png|thumbnail! |
|4,000|12.74s| !har-img-005.png|thumbnail! |

Monitoring the server resources shows an increase on the CPU usage for the database server.

If thread dumps are taken during the period of high load, we can see threads with stack traces similar to the below:
{code}
"http-nio-21310-exec-25" #767 daemon prio=5 os_prio=31 tid=0x00007fb7bad83800 nid=0x1b603 runnable [0x00007000257c7000]

h3. Workaround
Currently there's no workaround to prevent the behavior described above when the Spaces List Macro is used in a page.
Confluence administrators may choose to completely disable this macro to prevent issues affecting the whole instance:
# Go to *Cog icon* > *Manage Apps*.
# Search for _Dashboard Macros_ under _System_ Apps.
# Expand the _Dashboard Macros'_ modules.
# Disable the *spaces (spaces)* module.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Editing Word attachments is not launching the 'Companion App' but giving the following prompt to Install:
 !image-2020-05-06-15-07-40-093.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
# Confluence 7.4.0
# Companion App (v1.0.0)
# Windows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence 6.15.9
# Create a page and attach a .docx attachment to the page and Publish.
# Click on the attachment to Edit
# Companion App would be prompted to be downloaded and installed.
# Once the Installation completed, Word attachment should be able to be launched using the Companion App.
# Upgrade Confluence to 7.4.0
# Edit the .docx attachment.

h3. Expected Results
The Word Document should be able to be launched in the Companion App.

h3. Actual Results
 !image-2020-05-06-15-05-35-806.png|thumbnail! 

The following entry found to be stuck at 'Checking for update' in Companion.log file:
