fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Contributors plugin only scans the 10000 top-level pages and calculate the contributors on these pages (and their descendants).

Notes: The total number of pages being scanned could be much higher because the limit does not apply to the descendants of the top-level pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space with 100000 pages inside.
 # Insert a Contributors macro that shows the contributors in that space.

h3. Expected Results

Correct list of contributors
h3. Actual Results

Misleading list of contributors
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The Contributors plugin only scans the 10000 top-level pages and calculate the contributors on these pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem:

Users would like to have GUI option in the Confluence to fetch the list of all the spaces and pages which a group can access.
h3. Suggested Solution:

There should be options in Confluence where users can enter the group name and get a list of all the spaces (via space permissions) and pages (via page restrictions) where explicit the group was granted permissions in spaces and restrictions were applied on the pages.
h3. Why This Is Important: 

GUI option would be more feasible for Admins and user friendly.  
h3. Workaround

_This is possible using SQL queries._ 
 * _[How to list which spaces a group can access|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-list-which-spaces-a-group-can-access-720636535.html]_
fields.summary: Options to fetch the list of spaces and pages which a group can access.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we create a Jira issue from Confleucne (highlight or Jira issue macro), custom field options are not respected. The disabled options are visible and can be used to create the issues from Confluence
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Custom field on Jira (Select List (single choice)' Field).
 # Add multiple options and hit Create.
 # Configure this "custom field" and disable a few options.
 # Goto Confluence and create an Issue. This new custom field should be visible.

h3. Expected Results

You can only see the options that are "enabled" on Jira side
h3. Actual Results

You see all the options including the disabled. See the screenshot below.
h6. Jira custom field with disabled options
 !Jira_custom.png|thumbnail! 
 
h6. Creation on Jira issue from Confluence showing disabled option

 !Connie_Jira_create.png|thumbnail! 
  
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom field options from Jira are not respected while creating issues from Jira Issue Macro

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When importing a docx file with charts attached to a Confluence server, it will cause the CPU usage to spike to 100%. In order to get the threads released, we need to shutdown/kill the Confluence Java process.

This is noticed while adding the Word file as attachment as well.

h3. Environment
Reproducible in both 7.4.0 and 6.15.7.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Insert the docx file attached to a Confluence page in a local v7.4.0 instance and using the insert menu (please have a look at the video mp4 attached).

h3. Expected Results
The CPU usage should go down once the insert is completed. 

h3. Actual Results
The CPU usage is not released and Confluence needs to be restarted.

	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.ConversionRunnable.run(ConversionRunnable.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.conversion.impl.runnable.JVMConversionRunnable.run(JVMConversionRunnable.java:22)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(java.base@11.0.11/Executors.java:515)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(java.base@11.0.11/FutureTask.java:264)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(java.base@11.0.11/ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1128)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(java.base@11.0.11/ThreadPoolExecutor.java:628)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(java.base@11.0.11/Thread.java:829)
{code}
h3. Workaround
* Few workarounds are working in 7.4.0 such as saving the file as either a DOC or as a PDF file instead of DOCX. Then the import will not cause CPU spikes.
Instead of importing the document from the insert menu. You can use the "..." menu from the page to attach the .docx file there and it will not cause CPU spikes.
* Remove the charts from the file prior to upload. 
* Issue with uploading file as attachment doesn't happen in recent versions Confluence like *v7.11 and above*.

h3. Notes

I have attached the recording where I show the workarounds
- import the DOCX document from the "..." menu on the page, browsing the Attachments and attaching the document there (not inserting it inside the page)
- how the PDF and DOC version insertion is working fine whereas it is causing high CPU usages for the DOCX file.
fields.summary: High CPU threads (100% spikes) not released when importing or attaching a Word file with charts

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently, Confluence doesn't support or doesn't have a way to set the parameters to support  SASL Authentication when setting up SMTP Configuration. This is not possible neither via the Confluence UI or via the JNDI Configuration.

Based on the below link, JavaMail does support SASL Authentication however we don't have the parameters to set up Confluence to do so.
  * [Package com.sun.mail.smtp|https://javaee.github.io/javamail/docs/api/com/sun/mail/smtp/package-summary.html]
fields.summary: Implementation of SASL Support for SMTP Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is an error in exe installer on Windows during upgrade.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Windows, install confluence 6.8 or 6.9 or 6.15
 # Upgrade to 7.5 SNAPSHOT m68

h3. Expected Results

It should work without any error thrown.
h3. Actual Results

During upgrade, there is an error, to make it worse, if the user click `Quit` at this stage, this installation folder content will be gone. 

!6.8 6.9 6.15 upgrade to 7.5.png!
h3. Workaround

The user could click `Ignore` to proceed however if the user click `Quit` at this stage, confluence installation is gone. The user has to install a fresh new confluence and restore the previous installaion from backup file.
fields.summary: Confluence 7.5 Windows exe installer throws an error during upgrade
